Game-Based Learning


Overview

Game-based learning is an approach to instruction that has been gaining traction over the past few years. The term “game-based learning” refers to using video games to support teaching and learning. There has been an increase in the quantity of game-based learning options available, though not games are created equal. Today, teachers are faced with the challenge of deciding which games enhance rather than distract from student learning. Other factors, such as the cost and time to implement, must also be considered.

Students love video games

97% of kids, age 2 to 17, play video games (in America).

Digital games are becoming more common in the classroom

74% of American teachers use digital games for instructional purposes in grades K-8.

Game-based Learning increases brain growth

Studies have shown development in various brain regions such as the prefrontal cortex, the hippocampus, and the cerebellum after two months of playing digital games.

Effective for improving learning

According to the Mind Research Institute, 75% of teachers who have used digital games in the math classroom have seen an improvement in student learning.
